Package jogl

Class ExampleScene

  • java.lang.Object
    • jogl.ExampleScene
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.jogamp.opengl.GLEventListener, java.util.EventListener
    public class ExampleScene
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.jogamp.opengl.GLEventListener
    This is our scene. It contains everything needed to display an object with OpenGL. It implements the GLEventListener interface, so that it can be put onto a canvas. That way we can react to canvas events like display(), dispose(), and initialize(). The canvas will call display() on this scene 60 times in a second.

      ExampleScene()

      void display​(com.jogamp.opengl.GLAutoDrawable canvas)

      void init​(com.jogamp.opengl.GLAutoDrawable canvas)
      This OpenGL Canvas Event is triggered once, when the window is started.
      void reshape​(com.jogamp.opengl.GLAutoDrawable canvas, int x, int y, int width, int height)
      This OpenGL Canvas Event is triggered when the window is resized and once at the beginning.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init​(com.jogamp.opengl.GLAutoDrawable canvas)
        This OpenGL Canvas Event is triggered once, when the window is started. This is where we can initialize all OpenGL variables.
        Specified by:
        init in interface com.jogamp.opengl.GLEventListener

      • dispose

        public void dispose​(com.jogamp.opengl.GLAutoDrawable canvas)
        This OpenGL Canvas Event is triggered when the window is closed. This is where we should delete our OpenGL objects from the GPU.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface com.jogamp.opengl.GLEventListener

      • display

        public void display​(com.jogamp.opengl.GLAutoDrawable canvas)
        This OpenGL Canvas Event is triggered 6o times a second. This is where we should draw our OpenGL objects into the canvas.
        Specified by:
        display in interface com.jogamp.opengl.GLEventListener

      • reshape

        public void reshape​(com.jogamp.opengl.GLAutoDrawable canvas,
                    int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height)
        This OpenGL Canvas Event is triggered when the window is resized and once at the beginning. This is where we should update our view transformation to respect the aspect ratio of the window.
        Specified by:
        reshape in interface com.jogamp.opengl.GLEventListener
